results.adx_keywords: Recalls and Bans of Products;Eyes and Eyesight;Bacteria;Infections;Antibiotics;Drug Resistance (Microbial);Deaths (Fatalities);Centers for Disease Control and Prevention;Food and Drug Administration
results.title: Eye Drops Are Recalled After Being Linked to Vision Loss and 1 Death
results.abstract: The maker of EzriCare Artificial Tears said it was recalling the eye drops after U.S. health authorities linked the product to a drug-resistant bacteria strain.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said that the bacteria strain linked to EzriCare Artificial Tears had been found in 55 people in a dozen states as of Tuesday.
media.copyright: Christian Hansen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Comedy and Humor
results.title: Jimmy Kimmel Addresses Netflix’s Plan to Charge for Shared Accounts
results.abstract: “I understand. You don’t like paying for TV,” Kimmel said. “So, let me just say this: My name is Jimmy and I’m free every night, no charge.”

media.caption: “This is going to be a huge blow to Nick Cannon,” Jimmy Kimmel said. “This could cost him millions of dollars.”

results.adx_keywords: Diabetes;Weight;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Diet and Nutrition;Doctors
results.title: Ozempic Can Cause Major Weight Loss. What Happens if You Stop Taking It?
results.abstract: As more patients turn to diabetes medications for other uses, a shortage has taken hold. But doctors say going off these drugs can take a toll.

media.copyright: Ryan David Brown for The New York Times

results.title: An Even Deadlier Pandemic Could Soon Be Here
results.abstract: Bird flu has spread widely among animals. Unless we act now, it soon could do the same among humans.

media.caption: A pelican suspected to have died from H5N1 avian influenza on a beach in Peru in December.
media.copyright: Ernesto Benavides/Agence France-Presse, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Child Abuse and Neglect;Child Pornography;Pop and Rock Music;Glitter, Gary;McCreath, Alistair;Great Britain
results.title: Gary Glitter Is Released From Prison After Serving Half of His Sentence
results.abstract: The disgraced former glam rock singer was found guilty in 2015 of sexually abusing three young girls in the 1970s. He had been given a 16-year sentence.

media.caption: Paul Gadd, better known by his stage name, Gary Glitter, arrived at court in London in 2015. He has been released after spending eight years in prison.

results.adx_keywords: Child Pornography;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Bitcoin (Currency);Black Markets;Frauds and Swindling;Musbach, John Michael;Justice Department;New Jersey
results.title: Man Paid $20,000 in Bitcoin in Failed Attempt to Have 14-Year-Old Killed, U.S. Says
results.abstract: John Michael Musbach, 31, of Haddonfield, N.J., tried to hire a hit man to kill a child with whom he had exchanged sexually explicit photos, federal prosecutors said.

media.caption: The Mitchell H. Cohen U.S. Courthouse in Camden, N.J., where John Michael Musbach pleaded guilty on Thursday in a failed murder-for-hire scheme.

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Money Laundering;Identity Theft;Flores, Anthony D;Moore, Anna R (Actor);Malibu (Calif)
results.title: Actress and Hairdresser Took $3 Million From Malibu Doctor, Prosecutors Say
results.abstract: They feigned friendship, moving into the ailing doctor’s beachfront home and giving him drugs, while they spent his money, according to the federal indictment. Both face a range of charges.

media.caption: Anna R. Moore, an actress, and Anthony D. Flores, a hairdresser, at a party in Los Angeles in 2017.

results.adx_keywords: Mass Shootings;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Drug Cartels;Gangs;Goshen (Calif);California
results.title: Two Men Arrested in Execution-Style Killings of a Family in California
results.abstract: The brutal nature of the mass shooting, which included the murder of an innocent young mother and her infant, shocked the nation.

media.caption: Noah David Beard was one of two suspects arrested early Friday and charged with killing six members of a family in a small California town last month.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Conservatism (US Politics);Men and Boys;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;internal-sub-only
results.title: ‘The Last of Us’ Is a Very Conservative Show. Really.
results.abstract: The right should love its view of masculinity, the government and what it takes to survive.

media.copyright: Illustration by Zisiga Mukulu/The New York Times; photographs by Liane Hentscher/HBO

results.byline: By Judson Jones and Jenna Russell
results.title: Northeast Braces for the Worst Wind Chill in Decades
results.abstract: Forecasters say a dangerous cold will grip parts of the region on Friday and into Saturday.

media.caption: In New York City, which saw its first measurable snowfall this week, the wind chill could be below zero by Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Defense and Military Forces;Putin, Vladimir V;Milley, Mark A;North Atlantic Treaty Organization;Wagner Group;Russia;Ukraine;Donbas (Ukraine)
results.byline: By Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
results.title: Soaring Death Toll Gives Grim Insight Into Russian Tactics
results.abstract: Moscow is sending poorly trained recruits, including convicts, to the front lines in eastern Ukraine to pave the way for more seasoned fighters, U.S. and allied officials say.

media.caption: Ukrainian medical evacuation team members await calls for wounded soldiers in the Donbas region in eastern Ukraine, which has been the scene of heavy fighting.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.title: Pentagon Says It Detected a Chinese Spy Balloon Hovering Over Montana
results.abstract: The revelation comes days before Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s visit to Beijing, where he is expected to meet with President Xi Jinping.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: In an image provided by the U.S. Air Force, an airman working on an intercontinental ballistic missile at Malmstrom Air Force Base in Montana. The Pentagon said a surveillance balloon was hovering over the state on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Senior Airman Tristan Day/U.S. Air Force, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Tennis;Decisions and Verdicts;Kyrgios, Nick;Uber Technologies Inc;Canberra (Australia);Australia
results.title: Court Dismisses Guilty Plea by Australian Tennis Star Nick Kyrgios in Assault Case
results.abstract: The guilty plea and dismissal stemmed from a confrontation Mr. Kyrgios had with his partner in 2021 when she tried to prevent him from leaving in a ride-hailing car.

media.caption: Nick Kyrgios arriving at court in Canberra, Australia, on Friday.

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Invasive Species;Spotted Lanternflies;Racial Profiling;Women and Girls;internal-sub-only;New Jersey Institute of Technology;Yale University;Caldwell (NJ);New Jersey
results.title: Someone Called the Police on a Girl Catching Lanternflies. Then Yale Honored Her.
results.abstract: Bobbi Wilson, 9, was hunting for spotted lanternflies, an invasive species, in New Jersey. A neighbor called the police, but her effort has since earned recognition “from far and wide,” her mother said.

media.caption: A collection of lanternflies caught by Bobbi Wilson in her New Jersey neighborhood will sit in the archives of the Yale Peabody Museum.

results.adx_keywords: Organized Crime;Pizza;Fugitives;Messina Denaro, Matteo;Interpol (International Criminal Police Organization);Calabria (Italy);Italy;France
results.title: Italian Mobster, 16 Years on the Lam, Is Found Working at a Pizzeria
results.abstract: Edgardo Greco, 63, was arrested as he was about to start a night shift at a restaurant in France. Investigators identified him through online photographs.

media.caption: Police officers outside the hide-out of Matteo Messina Denaro, Italy’s most wanted mafia boss, after his January arrest. Mr. Messina Denaro lived a glitzy life; the most recent fugitive arrested did not.

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;District Attorneys;Insurance;Clifford, Stephanie (1979- );Cohen, Michael D (1966- );Trump, Donald J;Weisselberg, Allen;Bragg, Alvin;Trump Organization;Manhattan (NYC)
results.byline: By Ben Protess, William K. Rashbaum and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: Former Trump Executive, Already Jailed, Could Face More Fraud Charges
results.abstract: Manhattan prosecutors warned that they might charge Allen H. Weisselberg with insurance fraud to pressure him to cooperate in an investigation of the former president.

media.caption: Allen H. Weisselberg is already serving a five-month sentence at Rikers Island after pleading guilty to tax fraud last year.

results.adx_keywords: Missing Persons;Police;Kelly, Armani;Givens, Montoya;Wicker, Dante;Detroit (Mich);Highland Park (Mich);Michigan;Warren (Mich)
results.byline: By April Rubin and Remy Tumin
results.title: Bodies of 3 Men Are Found After They Disappeared in Detroit
results.abstract: They were discovered at an abandoned building 12 days after the men were supposed to meet at a rap show. The police called their deaths homicides but said the cause and motive were still unknown.

media.caption: The bodies were discovered on Thursday in an abandoned apartment building in Highland Park, Mich.

results.adx_keywords: Aircraft Carriers;Asbestos;Recycling of Waste Materials;Oceans and Seas;Environment;internal-sub-only;Sok Denizcilik;Brazil
results.title: A Proud Ship Turned Into a Giant Recycling Problem. So Brazil Plans to Sink It.
results.abstract: The old aircraft carrier, once the navy’s flagship, is packed with asbestos. No country, including Brazil, will let it dock to be dismantled.

media.caption: The São Paulo, a Clemenceau-class carrier laid down in 1957, has not seen active service in roughly a decade.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Joe Frasure Jr.;Ohio;Wyoming, Ohio
results.title: Officers Will Not Face Charges in Fatal Ohio Shooting, Prosecutor Says
results.abstract: Relatives of Joe Frasure Jr. said he had been cleaning out his grandmother’s apartment when officers responded to a burglary call.

media.caption: A prosecutor said Wyoming, Ohio, police officers will not face charges after fatally shooting a man outside this building on Monday.
